title: UiB Collaborative Platform for GIS/RS
text:
A hands-on, immersive experience combining UAV fieldwork and geospatial analysis.


The 2-Day UAV and Remote Sensing Workshop offers an engaging mix of field missions, data processing, and applied GIS/RS learning. Join researchers, students, and professors for a practical and theoretical deep dive into modern UAV-based landscape analysis.

🚁 On-site UAV Flights & Data Collection: Learn mission planning, data capture, and safety.
🖥️ Evening Lab Sessions: Turn raw drone imagery into real geospatial products.
🗺️ Integrated Theory & Application: Taught by specialists in UAVs and environmental RS.


Learn more about our program




Set in a stunning mountain landscape ideal for UAV-based environmental monitoring — only 8 spots available!



💰 All costs covered: Transportation, accommodation, and meals are fully funded for selected participants.

🎒What to bring: A personal laptop is required. Also bring appropriate field gear (e.g. hiking boots, waterproof layers).
🕐 Application Deadline: 9 May 2025


Apply here! See you soon.

title: UiB Collaborative Platform for GIS/RS
text:
A UiB collaborative platform for GIS/RS methods


Join a growing community of researchers and students from diverse academic backgrounds united by a shared interest in Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and Remote Sensing (RS). Through seminars, workshops, and conferences, participants have the opportunity to present their work, engage in meaningful discussions, and explore innovative applications of GIS and RS in tackling today’s environmental challenges.
Our network currently brings together 55 active members from the University of Bergen (UiB), spanning the Departments of Earth Science, Biology, Geography, Physics, and Archaeology—representing three faculties. We are also proud to have established a strong collaborative partnership with the Theoretical and Computational Ecology group at the University of Amsterdam (UvA), expanding our reach and impact across institutions.
Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or would like to discuss potential participation and projects.

title: UiB Collaborative Platform for GIS/RS
text:
A unique opportunity to engage with researchers and students from interdisciplinary backgrounds.


Spatio-temporal analyses of landscape dynamics across the biosphere, geosphere, and cryosphere are crucial in tackling today’s global environmental challenges. From land use and cover changes to glacier retreat and vegetation shifts, Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and Remote Sensing (RS) offer essential tools for research and real-world problem-solving.

🖥️ Hybrid Format: Register to get your invitation!
📍 University of Bergen (UiB): In person sessions.
📅 May 2025 to June 2026: Have a look on our Sessions Calendar.
🌍 Global Atendees and Audience: Let’s connect with the world…
